title: Sunshine on Scotland Street
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: "I suppose I can see what's available tomorrow, flight-wise. You can get to quite a few places from Edinburgh Airport these days."

title: Bertie Plays the Blues
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: after all, and yet it seemed to me that you excluded me more or less from the time we left Edinburgh Airport. And then, whenever I said anything, Domenica pretended not to hear – have you any idea how painful that was for me?

title: The Unbearable Lightness of Scones
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: "Oh boy, is your profile going to be raised! You'll be on that poster in the airport. You know the one that greets you as you come down the steps at Edinburgh Airport? The one that says Welcome to Scotland?

title: The Unbearable Lightness of Scones
author: McCall Smith, Alexander

title: Bertie's Guide to Life and Mothers
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Sister Maria-Fiore dei Fiori di Montagna had a tendency to make philosophical remarks, and she had become accustomed to them, whether issued in the nun's native Italian or, as now, in her passable, though sometimes halting, English. There had been one such remark when they had arrived at Edinburgh Airport. There, as they walked through the door into the arrivals hall, she had said, "Airports are the places where we land – where we come to earth."
